doc.previous: Lacsa was established on 17 October 1945 by Pan American World Airways the Costa Rican government and Costa Rican private interests It started operations on 1 June 1946 and was designated the national carrier in 1949 Its domestic network was transferred to its wholly owned subsidiary Sansa in September 1959
doc.after: Lacsa operated the Douglas DC 6B four engined piston airliner from 1960 until 1976 on their regular passenger and eventually freight scheduled flights to Miami International Airport The airline introduced the first of their British Aircraft Corporation BAC One Eleven twin engined jet airliners onto their Caribbean passenger route network in April 1967 4
